attributes.action: Introduce mandatory training in autism for all NHS mental health services.
attributes.background:
1 in 68 people has an ASC. 
Over 50% of autistic people have depression. 
They are 28 times more likely to exhibit suicidal thoughts/behaviours. 
There is difficultly in accessing support, and staff are insufficiently trained. According to NAS, Transforming Care implementation needs improvement.
attributes.additional_details:
Because of the additional need for support, all mental health services are guaranteed to treat some autistic patients. However, many staff have no training in this whatsoever.   

Even basic training would have an immediate impact on helping autistic people engage with services effectively. 

Inpatient mental health care should be viewed as our last line of defence. Therefore it is imperative that these staff have, at minimum, a basic understanding of autism spectrum conditions.

attributes.action: cut costs for NHS staff to park on site at work and provide permits to all staff
attributes.background: Currently there is an extremely long waiting list for a permit (>4 years). Staff are forced to park off site and walk alone in dark areas to their cars which is very unsafe and due to excessive amounts of staff having to park off site means having to arrive 45 mins prior to shift starting.
attributes.additional_details: £20 a day on site parking would be the only other option which is not affordable.

attributes.action: Raise a Brain Aneurysm Awareness campaign
attributes.background: I recently lost my sister to a ruptured brain aneurysm. After numerous visits to doctors and hospitals for over a month. Not one of them even suspected this despite having all the symptoms of brain aneurysm.
attributes.additional_details:
One doctor suggested applying a hot water bottle to her head!!!
AWARENESS IS NEEDED.

attributes.action: Bring carers allowance into line with jobseekers allowance.
attributes.background: People who are full time carers for loved ones can apply for carers allowance which the government recognise as working 35 hours per week caring for someone. Yet despite this carers get less money per week than people who are unemployed and are not eligible for any discounted travel.
attributes.additional_details:
People who are full time carers for loved ones can apply for carers allowance which the government recognise as working 35 hours per week caring for someone. Yet despite this carers allowance is set at £62.70 per week and are not eligible for any help in the form of discounted travel cards. However a person who is unemployed gets £73.10 and who has been for a period of 13 weeks gets a bus pass for duscounted travel. 
How is this fair??

attributes.action: PIP assessment for Mental health carried out by a doctor or mental health nurse
attributes.background:
PIP assessments for mental health should be carried out by mental health professionals.
I have been diagnosed with manic depression and been unable to claim PIP even though I meet all of the criteria, I'm now having to appeal which will eventually end up in a tribunal which will cost £100's and I'm
attributes.additional_details: not alone, so many of us that suffer from manic depression get rejected on PIP even though we all struggle, we then have more stress incurred through rejected appeals and hundreds of pounds from the government waisted for it to be over turned by the judge, if we just followed correct procedure and carried out the assessment properly with qualified memeber's of staff we would not only save money but also stress and potentially triggering worse episodes.

attributes.action: Provide funding for specialist services for children with severe obesity
attributes.background: Childhood obesity can be the result and cause of other mental and physical health issues, such as type 2 diabetes, fatty liver and poor mobility. Specialist services and adequate funding for children with severe or morbid obesity (Tier 3) are urgently needed.
attributes.additional_details: A third of children in the UK are overweight or obese; for those with severe or morbid obesity (Tier 3) their weight is physically and emotionally debilitating. Adult Tier 3 services are available and funded but only 7% of LA/CCG provide Tier 3 services for children. The Government needs to provide adequate funding for specialist obesity services for children with complex needs, provide clear guidance on commissioning services and invest in the treatment services needed.

attributes.action: End benefit sanctions, punishments to make the poor more poor.
attributes.background:
The welfare state was invented to support those in need, to support those in need. It should never be used as a form of finacial blackmail. Sanctions make people need more, they make poor people more poor and they victimise the most vulnerable in our society. 

it is time we put an end to this.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence to support this is in the fact that use of food banks has risen so dramatically. That homelessness has more than doubled. 

There is also the fact that I have endured sanctions myself, where I went weeks without money and had to use food banks myself. 

The evidence is everywhere, and has been in the news, there have been studies after studies that have said that sanctions and universal credit are causing more poverty. 

It is time to stop using abject poverty as a punishment.

attributes.action: Drastically improve funding for mental health services
attributes.background: I have personally experienced the impact of the cuts to mental health services when I needed the help the most and I know I am not the only one who has experienced this: child or adult. There needs to be far more funding and support from the Government, but more importantly the Minister of Health.
attributes.additional_details: One in four people will experience or may have already experienced mental health problems. The Government really need to start helping those in need and support those that are in need of help. Increased funding to mental health services will drastically reduce the waiting time children, adolescents and adults have to wait to begin counselling and therapy.

attributes.action: Lower the age restriction on smear tests to allow women under 25 to be eligible.
attributes.background:
- Sexual activity is legal from the age of 16, therefore so should smear tests
- Some women go for their first smear test at 25 & are having some sort of minor procedure which could have been resolved years prior. 
- Our health doesn’t have a start date for complications, it can happen at any age!
attributes.additional_details:
Below is reference of a case where a woman wasn’t taken seriously on her symptoms.

If your old enough to engage in sexual activity; your old enough to be taken seriously with any health symptoms & concerns you may have. 

The cervical cancer injection is powerless on its own, however with the age of the smear tests being lowered I think it would be effective. 

http://metro.co.uk/2015/07/24/this-21-year-old-mum-has-just-two-years-to-live-after-being-denied-a-smear-test-5310462/

attributes.action: Reinstate sailing and windsurfing to A level and GCSE PE
attributes.background: Recently sailing and windsurfing have been taken off the list of sports you can be marked on for GCSE and A level PE. Some people started this course unaware of this change.
attributes.additional_details: Sailing and Windsurfing should be reinstated as you have to be physically fit to compete, you can race and it involves refining technique to do well. The UK is an island which mean there are plenty of places for young people to participate in these activities.

attributes.action: Secure the free movement of UK citizens currently resident in EU member states
attributes.background:
The current deal between the EU and UK regarding Brexit states UK citizens will be able to carry on enjoying the same rights as of now in the country we live in. It doesn’t not state we will continue to enjoy free movement within the union. 
Many british Expats in the EU depend on this for work.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people work over borders within the EU.
Many have family in other EU countries.
We have integrated ourselves into the union through free movement.

attributes.action: Allow the collection of store points when purchasing stage one infant formula.
attributes.background:
You are unable to earn Boots Advantage Card points, Tesco Clubcard or Nectar points when buying stage one baby milk, as it is perceived to discourage breastfeeding. 
I believe this law should be changed so that families who can't or chose not to breastfeed their children are not being penalised.
attributes.additional_details: The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula Regulation 2007 prohibits the promotion of formula feeding & this includes allowing families to earn points for buying stage one formula, points can also not be used to buy formula. Points are available when purchasing items relating to breastfeeding (breast pumps/ pads etc). Therefore I believe it to be discriminatory against those who can't or don't want to breastfeed their children that points cannot be collected against stage one formula.

attributes.action: Make photo ID mandatory in all elections and Referenda.
attributes.background: We believe production of photo ID in all future elections and Referenda should be mandatory. There have been several examples of personation in elections. Bringing in mandatory photo ID when voting would remove this problem.

attributes.action: Secure the release of Jack Letts who is detained in northern Syria
attributes.background: Our son, Jack Letts, has been 'disappeared' in a Guantanamo-style ‘black site’ in Kurdish territory in Syria and has had no contact with the outside world since July 8. The British government is refusing to engage with the Kurdish authorities to secure his release. We greatly fear for his life.
attributes.additional_details: The British police told us there is no evidence Jack was involved in violence in Syria. However, the government believes it has public opinion on its side in keeping Jack without charge in foreign detention. The press has condemned him as a jihadi, despite evidence showing he courageously stood against Isis. His detention conditions are appalling, including no exercise and months in solitary confinement. If there are charges against him, he should be allowed to defend himself in a British court.

attributes.action: Provide adequate parking facilities for HGV Drivers
attributes.background: With the DVSA imposing new regulations from 4/11/17 regarding where HGV drivers can legally take their weekly rest breaks we are petitioning for adequate facilities to be made available to HGV drivers
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to raise awareness of the issues faced by HGV drivers across the uk with the lack of adequate rest areas available to them at a reasonable/no cost. With the DVSA imposing more regulations on drivers from 4/11/17 preventing HGV drivers stopping for their 45 hour legal weekly rest break in lay-bys, we demand that the government/department of transport start providing adequate,safe,hygienic and reasonably priced rest areas with a good standard of food and facilities.

attributes.action: End the benefits freeze
attributes.background: The freeze of working age benefits will take almost £1 billion from the pockets of people living in Scotland by 2020/21. People across Scotland are affected by the freeze and by ending it we will improve both our society and the economy by putting money in people’s pockets.
attributes.additional_details:
Keeping the cash value of benefits the same while costs are rising is pushing people into poverty. The freeze on working age benefits will affect around 750,000 households by the end of the decade.
Reversing the freeze could help lift people out of poverty and prevent others from falling into poverty. Research from CPAG shows that reversing the freeze to even just the child element of tax credits and child benefit could keep up to 400,000 children across the UK from falling into poverty.

attributes.action: The UK must NOT adopt any new EU legislation during the "transition period".
attributes.background: On June 23rd 2016 the UK voted to Leave the European Union. We voted to take back control of our laws. If we are to have a "transition period" it would be completely unacceptable for the UK to accept any new EU rules and regulations during this transition period.
attributes.additional_details: Brexit means taking back control of our money, our borders, our trade deals and our laws. We voted for significant change and we expect to see change.

attributes.action: Extend VAT exemption for elderly/disabled peoples' domestic help in their homes
attributes.background:
Since 2007 we have run a business supporting elderly/disabled people with domestic help,enabling them to remain safely and independently in their own homes.
Domestic Care companies should be able to offer a reputable service on a VAT exempt basis to make it more affordable to self funding clients.
attributes.additional_details:
We wrote to our local MP, his reply states he agrees with the proposal.
The CQC web site details that only companies offering personal care can be regulated.VAT Notice 701/2 on HMRC web site confirms regulated group limitations.
Most personal care companies don't want to do domestic care  and vice versa.The two services are very different but,both essential to the elderly/disabled.
Elderly people should not have to be taxed on a service which enables them to remain independently in their homes

attributes.action: Put a drug education system in schools
attributes.background: Drug taking is becoming the 'in' thing and people are becoming more curious about drugs at younger ages, to help save lives, a drug education system should be put into schools.

attributes.action: Manufacture the new blue passport in GB not Germany or France.
attributes.background:
The new blue passports have been hailed as a sign Britain is seizing back control from the EU - but they could end up being made in France or Germany.
When the uk should be manufacturing these with the uk company De La Rue who produces this & many other documents, secure British jobs not eu.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has released the information into the news that they could give a French or German company £490 million.
So the £490,000,000 will not be supporting British jobs or support people paying British tax, this will take money out of our country.
Please sign and share.

attributes.action: Give parents the right to make an audio recording with social workers
attributes.background: I wanted an audio recording of a meeting with social services as I have a disability which makes it difficult to take notes and affects my memory. I also felt under stress and worried that things I have said or others have said might not be recorded accurately. I wasn’t allowed to record it.
attributes.additional_details: I informed them in writing I would record the whole meeting & it would not be edited. I would send an unedited copy of the recording to the other people at the meeting. Also the recording was for my own use, for any court proceedings or taking legal advice. I would not distribute it on the internet. This is allowed under the Data Protection 1997 Act, Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000 & the Human Rights Act Article 10. There is no law saying I need their permission. I am not a data controller so I am not bound by the act.

attributes.action: Stop kids under 16 buying all energy drinks
attributes.background: Energy drinks are full of caffeine - no wonder kids have bad attitudes and are hyped all the time. They're pumped up on caffeine.

attributes.action: To retract the £1bn DUP deal and use the money across the whole United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Conservative Party promised £1bn to Northern Ireland as part of a deal to secure a majority government with the Democratic Unionist Party. This deal should be suspended and the £1bn should be spent  across the whole of the UK, not to prop up a Parliamentary majority.

attributes.action: GPs & other professionals to be given  training on pulmonary fibrosis
attributes.background: My wife has just been diagnosed with this horrible illness. Going online, I found that a lot of people suffering are begging for help, saying that their GPs cannot help them and relying on people with this illness for help on reading most of their problems.
attributes.additional_details: Even some comforting advice would go a long way from them struggling for it. As a group on facebook they are trying to console and help each other. But it's expert advice they are begging for but are being fobbed off by most of their GPs. This is very important as my wife until Christmas was my carer but now we are both relying on our two daughters having to work part time for us. My wife was a council carer working till she retired so she has had no proper retirement, both of us are 72 this year.

attributes.action: Make NHS England declare by law the value of contracts awarded to private bodies
attributes.background: Last year private companies won nearly 70% of all NHS contracts. Making public declaration of all assets sold (and scope of contracts won) a legal requirement would allow the public to see a true picture of the extent of NHS privatisation. The public deserves better visibility, and to be consulted.
attributes.additional_details:
All services run by non NHS bodies and all assets sold should be declared publicly, and made visible to the public where they operate and on their communications. 

Private care providers were awarded 267 out of a total of 386 contracts made available in 2016-17, including the seven highest value opportunities, worth £2.4bn. 
Source: 'Time to end the NHS experiment with the market', NHS Support Federation, Dec 2017.

attributes.action: Raise the Minimum Wage for under 25s and apprentices
attributes.background: The Government's National Living Wage does not apply to those under the age of 25, who can be paid as little as £3.50 per hour if they are an apprentice or £4.05 otherwise.
attributes.additional_details:
It is an absolute scandal that this Tory government is forcing younger across the UK to live on poverty pay by refusing to give under 25s the basic protection of the National Living Wage.

This is an issue of fairness and equality. If you do the same job you should be paid at the same rate regardless of your age, and everyone should be paid at least the living wage so that they have enough money to feed themselves and cover the basics, like their rent and bills.

attributes.action: Force the legal separation of ticketing companies from ticket resale companies.
attributes.background:
The ticketing companies have no interest in selling all tickets at original face value as they will inflate their profits by selling them through their related businesses.
"Sold out" tickets appear on resale sites within minutes of release for several times the face value.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing ticketing companies to own related companies which can resell tickets at a higher price has an inherent conflict.

attributes.action: Mandatory bike helmets for ALL cyclists, on ALL bikes on ALL terrains
attributes.background: A friend on his bike was hit by a car. He was lucky, he could have died but he HAD a helmet on which saved his life. People are not so lucky if they’re not wearing a helmet.
attributes.additional_details:
The Consultant in Neurosciences Intensive Care, Wessex Neurological Centre, "It is my job .... to not only save lives but try to make those lives worth living. Cycle helmets offer vital protection to one’s fragile skull and can save lives and significantly reduce damage to the brain in the event of an impact. If every cyclist wore a helmet the number of cyclists killed or seriously injured each year would be reduced."

http://www.headwayoxford.org.uk/cyclehelmets/ (17 July 2017)

attributes.action: Outlaw the excessive noise levels that are associated with fireworks.
attributes.background: The explosions that are part of many firework displays are uncomfortably loud to humans and are very often terrifying to animals who suffer as a result.The bangs are not a necessary part of the display and the spectacle would not suffer if loud bangs were not part of it.

attributes.action: Smart Brexit:  Apply to rejoin EFTA
attributes.background: A 'hard Brexit' is a nightmare scenario for the UK, in which jobs and trade will suffer catastrophically. However, the U.K. can maintain free trade with the EU by applying to European Free Trade Association (EFTA) Council to rejoin EFTA and regain powers to write trade deals with non EU countries.
attributes.additional_details: The EFTA countries enjoy unparalleled access to EU goods and services markets. EFTA citizens enjoy free movement across EEA/EU states. EFTA States have 27 free trade agreements, covering 38 countries including Canada, and are close to signing an FTA with India. In addition, EFTA is outside the EU foreign, justice, agriculture and fisheries policies. Overall, reductions in net cost to the UK have been estimated at between 17% and 60% of current payments.

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed
attributes.background: To grant the right for people in rented accommodation who are struggling with emotional distress, depression – to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.
attributes.additional_details: Please visit: http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: include The Baha'i Faith as part of the Religious Studies Syllabus in Schools.
attributes.background:
The Baha'i Faith is the world's youngest religion. It is only 173 years old.

It brings all other major religions together and is based on Unity of Mankind.

It makes sense! and can potentially save a lot of conflicts in the world.
attributes.additional_details:
www.bahai.org

There are over 6 million Baha'is in the world and the interesting concept is that they come from all sorts of backgrounds.

attributes.action: Smear tests for women every year to prevent cervical cancer.
attributes.background: Would like to see the smear tests for women every year to prevent cervical cancer, not every three years. Because more and more young mums with cervical cancer are dying each year and the quicker it's detected the better chance of survival.

attributes.action: Keep the iconic burgundy British passport
attributes.background: The government has stated its intention to change UK passports from red to blue. This needless colour change would bring no benefits. Since no under-40 ever possessed a blue passport, a change would mean little except to a shrinking minority. To young people, the red passport is the iconic one.
attributes.additional_details:
Changing the colour would be a backwards step for a country that seeks, in the words of the Prime Minister, to be a forward-looking nation with a 'dynamic, creative spirit'.

It is also unclear why, since we are exiting the EU, we would want to change passports from the current patriotic red to the colours of the EU flag. Since EU member states are allowed any colour of passport they like, changing would be no great statement of sovereignty, as some have suggested.

While frivolous petitions are quite rightfully rejected, passport colour is of serious concern to many around the country. As the Immigration Minister says: “One of the most iconic things about being British is having a British passport.” I trust, therefore, that this petition will be treated with the seriousness it merits.

attributes.action: Review the exclusion of alternative milks to dairy using Healthy Start Vouchers
attributes.background: Approx 2 million people live in the UK with a food allergy (National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence, 2011). Cows milk costs 43p/L. Oat milk costs £1.79/L The cost of alternative milks on low income families is detrimental. Alternative formula costs more than £30 per tin.
attributes.additional_details:
Alternative milk eg: oat milk contains 36% RDA for calcium; 1 serving of whole milk contains 28%. An allergy can be considered a disability. It is discrimatory to exclude low income families from their non-dairy nutritional needs: the Equality Act (2010) is not being upheld. If it is sufficient to expect the sole purpose of non-dairy users to use them on fruit & veg, then why include cows milk or formula at all?
https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=396559724104198&id=296629500763888

attributes.action: Amend driving licences to remove the unnecessary title from women's licences.
attributes.background: UK driving licences betray a clear and unwarranted gender bias. Men's driving licences are in their name without a title: John Smith. Women's driving licences contain a title: Miss Joan Smith. There is no reason for this. Someone's marital or academic status has no impact on their ability to drive.

attributes.action: For All prisons in the Uk to become 'Autism friendly'
attributes.background: There is very little training in prisons for officers/ staff to recognise and support Autistic adults  entering the prison and  serving  their sentence. Only one prison in the UK called Feltham, has been Autism accredited and has made such a huge impact on supporting Autistic prisoners .

attributes.action: Require in law that branding/ads must show a variety of real body shapes
attributes.background: The current position of the Committee of Advertising Practice is that “the use of thin models itself is not considered socially irresponsible.” Advertising Codes reflect UK Law. The Government should therefore make it a legal requirement for advertising to show a variety of real body shapes.
attributes.additional_details:
Images, models and mannequins inform our society:
“81% of 10-year-olds are afraid of being fat." (Rust, 2010 in ukessays.com) 
"The current media ideal of thinness for women is achievable by less than 5% of the female population." 
“…ample empirical research is available documenting associations between idealised images of female beauty and negative effects on women’s (and increasingly men's) physical, psychological, and social well-being (Thompson et al., 1999 in Calogero et al., 2007).

attributes.action: Mandate re-homing of suitable beagles and other species used for animal research
attributes.background: An Advice Note was issued by the Animal Scientific Regulation Unit at the Home Office in 2015 encouraging research/ breeding facilities to re-home these animals but an Advice Note is not Mandatory.  There is evidence that animals are released under the radar or the advice is ignored.
attributes.additional_details: There can be a life after laboratories for suitable animals!!  Mandatory legislation will guarantee adherance to the law and will ensure that release & re-homings will be conducted officially and transparently for those animals who achieve the criteria in ASAP 1986. This will ensure that animals can enjoy normal lives in domestic enviroments once they have been socialised and domesticated properly, and re-homed to new owners who have been extensively checked as suitable.

attributes.action: Paediatric mental health training within the NHS medical staff
attributes.background: The issue is that the paediatric medical staff (NHS) doesn't know how to deal with mental health at all when a child is admitted to the ward for observation, with mental health training the staff  would be able to provide a better duty of care. (See additional details for a personal story)
attributes.additional_details:
Backround:
The reason for this petition is that my child has multiple mental illnesses and has been hospitalised as a result of this 5 times in 2017, when at the emergency department a lot of the staff was unsure what to do, they just sent the child up to the paediatric ward to be in overnight until CAMHS would arrive. However in all instances the staff was unsure what to do.

attributes.action: Ensure all button batteries (lithium) sold in UK have a quantum coat
attributes.background: My daughter Freya swallowed a button battery when she was 11 months, which stuck in her oesophagus for 4 weeks, before it was removed, causing a chemical burn. Had it gone into her stomach, it might have killed her. If a button battery has a quantum coat, it makes it safe & inert when swallowed.
attributes.additional_details:
A 'quantum coat' means it only conducts electricity when squeezed, stopping the highly toxic effect of the battery when swallowed, which causes children thousands of horrific injuries and fatalities every year.
 It is likely to cost mere pennies per battery. Please see these references to prove the accuracy of our petition.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-29885832

https://www.greenoptimistic.com/batteries-made-child-safe-new-quantum-coating-20141105/#.WmS61UvLhTY

attributes.action: Cyclist should be subjected to a CBT type training prior to using the highways.
attributes.background: Many cycle deaths are a result of improper road knowledge of cyclists. Cyclist, like scooter riders should be subjected to a basic compulsory training session to use the public highways. This will generate revenue for the government as well as reduce cycle fatalities.
attributes.additional_details: I am a cyclist and have completed training with my local authority. I was amazed to learn how much at risk we are when we make small mistakes e.g. Speeding, not indicating or being on the wrong lane or even, when we overtake other cyclists.

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave from 2 weeks to at least 4
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time to help with the mother and bond with the baby. 4 weeks should easily be the minimum to give dad's a better chance to bond and give the mother more support.
attributes.additional_details:
Men suffer from postnatal depression too. I did, and I went sick for 4 weeks. Having these extra weeks helped me bond with the baby instead of never seeing her due to work. Here's my story:

https://youtu.be/mt-yyjEotE0

This is something that benefits both the mother and the father, and is incredibly important for bonding in the early stages of a babies life.

attributes.action: Scrap the 25% overseas transfer charge expats pay on QROPS pensions
attributes.background: Expats pay the charge on moving pensions from the UK to a QROPS or between QROPS unless they live in Europe or one of 13 countries which have QROPS outside Europe, which is unfair to the thousands who cannot access a QROPS pension where they live
attributes.additional_details: The overseas transfer charge discriminates against expats outside the EEA in a country which does not host a QROPS, making them pay a 25% exit tax on moving their pension fund from the UK to a QROPS to gain better financial terms. The charge is unreasonable as the rules punish QROPS members for financial planning when savers with other pensions, like Self-Invested Personal Pensions (SIPPs), can live in the same place as a QROPS saver and suffer no transfer charge on moving their fund

attributes.action: Construct a bypass around Chideock, Dorset to relieve the traffic problems.
attributes.background:
A bypass is needed to divert the A35 trunk road away from the centre of this ancient village and improve the environment and road safety in the area.
Traffic delays potentially harm the much needed economic benefits of local tourism.
attributes.additional_details:
There are safety issues caused by the volume of traffic. Source for traffic volumes: David Peacock for Dorset CPRE (London Inn traffic 1986-2016)
There are health hazards arising from the traffic pollution. Source for air quality: www.dorsetforyou.gov.uk/airquality/chideock
The village contains 63 listed buildings and deserves proper conservation. Source for listed buildings: www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk

attributes.action: Protect pregnant air crew or trying to conceive from flying to zika countries
attributes.background: Regardless of all the government warnings about travelling to a zika destination when pregnant or trying to conceive, employers are forcing cabin crew, pilots or their partners to fly there risking the life and health of their unborn. We need a specific law to protect to people trying to conceive.
attributes.additional_details: All the information on the public health, government and centre for disease control and prevention all state that if you are trying to conceive or your partner is pregnant, you should not travel to zika destinations regardless of the risk level. If you are male it states that you can pass this on to your partner whether pregnant or not. The laws must also apply to partners. Airlines are forcing crew and pilots to continue flying risking the lives and health of their unborn.

attributes.action: Enable an ESA - Emotional Support Animal to be recognized as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I am wanting ESA (Emotional Support Animal) Service Dogs to be allowed to be recognized as an Assistance Service Dog along with Blind Guide Service Dogs.They should be allowed into restaurants/pubs/etc as they help people like myself who have Mental Health Issues/Mental Health Disabilities.
attributes.additional_details: I have panic attacks in my home and in public places. After I rescued Summer they aren't as bad or as common. When she knows something is wrong, she runs to me, sits down&begins licking me. The dog I rescued now helps with something I had to face several times a day. I need her with me in public places, just like others who need a Service Dog with them, we need to recognize ESA Service Dogs as Assistance Dogs too.

attributes.action: Please do not increase the IHS paid by migrants coming to the UK to £400
attributes.background:
We are asking Parliament to please consider the real impact this increase is going to have on families of British Citizens who are already struggling to pay for visas fees.
This increase will cause more broken families.
attributes.additional_details:
The IHS fee is paid on top of visa application fees, which are already extremely expensive. Such fees have thousands of families broken around the world because the British Citizen simply cannot afford to pay the cost of bringing his/her family to the UK.
Currently, immigrants pay £200 per year as an Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS) to contribute towards the cost of running the NHS. The government has announced that this fee will increase to £400 per year.

attributes.action: Make breaching Child Arrangement Orders a criminal offence enforceable by police
attributes.background: Breaching a Child Arrangement Order is a crime but currently the police are powerless. If an order is breached then the only option is to accept it or return to the courts to request enforcement action is taken against the other party. The process takes months, is expensive and emotionally draining.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving police power to enforce this crime would reduce the amount of people making a mockery out of the system. It would allow what the court has already decided as right and safe for the child, to continue without dispute.

There needs to be an instant deterrent, such as the issuing of an on the spot fine, with the amount increased after further breaches. Alternatively community service.

Why should the child suffer any longer then they have to when an informed decision has been made?

attributes.action: Change ethnicity classification of people of African & Caribbean descent in UK.
attributes.background:
I believe Africans and Caribbeans should not be referred to as Black British with a focus on the word "Black".

The right term should be either African British or Caribbean British just like we have Asian British etc.
attributes.additional_details: The word 'Black' has a negative connotation to it and should be removed from any reference made to and about Africans or Caribbeans.
